bibl.title: Letter from Austin Smith to Philip Showalter Hench, December 31, 1952

div1.p: Smith informs Hench that he can wait until the end of January for the Camp Lazear article and would like a photograph from the event.

div1.head: Letter from Austin Smith to Philip Showalter Hench, December 31, 1952
div1.opener:
EDITOR
AUSTIN SMITH, M.D.
ASSOCIATE EDITORS
JOHNSON F. HAMMOND, M.D.
GEORGE HALPERIN, M.D.
The Journal of the
American Medical Association
535 North Dearborn Street
Chicago 10
December 31, 1952
In your reply please
refer to these initials
AS:P
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
We certainly can wait until the end of January
for the material on Camp Lazear, and I would like to
have the photograph (glossy print) to see if we can
use it.

I appreciate very much your suggestion for a
correspondent in Havana. I am going to write to
him to see what his reaction may be.

Under separate cover we will send a check for
$15 to cover the cost of the wreath. We certainly
appreciate what you have done for us.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, Austin Smith, M. D. MP
